content:
• Monday, December 31, 2012
  • VELTF

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GASX +5.4%. VELT +3.2%. IFGL +2.1%. TRX +2%. VISN...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GASX +5.4%. VELT +3.2%. IFGL +2.1%. TRX +2%. VISN +2.0%.
    After-hours top losers: HHC -5.3%. NUS -4.6%. POWR -4.6%. WBC -4.5%. LINTA -3.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • OLED

    Beaten-down Universal Display (PANL +4.1%) finished 2012 with a solid gain after Cowen and JMP...

    Beaten-down Universal Display (PANL +4.1%) finished 2012 with a solid gain after Cowen and JMP each predicted the company could benefit from CES product announcements. Cowen thinks Samsung could introduce 5" 1080p OLED displays at CES (matching Sharp's LCD panels), and notes it's expected to show off a flexible 5.5" 720p panel. JMP thinks a 55" Samsung OLED TV could also appear, and points out there's growing speculation about phone launches involving flexible displays.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • VXX

    The apparent movement towards a deal has the VIX plunging 19%, one of its biggest single-day...

    The apparent movement towards a deal has the VIX plunging 19%, one of its biggest single-day implosions in years (and that's saying something). The "fear gauge" had made a big move higher since mid-December as traders bet on a D.C. agreement not being reached. Other big moves: August 2011, -27%, May 2010 -30%. VXX -10.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 10 Comments
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceutical's (SLXP +1.4%) moves up after the FDA approves Fulyzaq to relieve symptoms...

    Salix Pharmaceutical's (SLXP +1.4%) moves up after the FDA approves Fulyzaq to relieve symptoms of diarrhea in HIV/AIDS patients taking antiretroviral therapy. The drug, which is the first of its kind to relieve diarrhea in AIDS patients and is a common reason why patients discontinue or switch their antiretroviral therapies, is distributed by SLXP under license from Napo Pharmaceuticals.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • ELGX

    Endologix (ELGX +1%) says its distribution partner in Japan, Cosmotec, has received Shonin...

    Endologix (ELGX +1%) says its distribution partner in Japan, Cosmotec, has received Shonin approval from the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare to market the IntuiTrak Delivery System. The IntuiTrak System delivers ELGX's Powerlink anatomical fixation stent graft for the repair of abdominal aortic aneurysms.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +15.4%) moves up today on no company-specific news. The company...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +15.4%) moves up today on no company-specific news. The company earned fast track status earlier this month from the FDA for its LX1033 drug candidate, an orally delivered small molecule medication for irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • BTU

    Coal stocks are posting decent gains in response to a strong Chinese PMI reading. in addition to...

    Coal stocks are posting decent gains in response to a strong Chinese PMI reading. in addition to Cliffs Natural, Peabody Energy (BTU +3.5%), Arch Coal (ACI +3%), Alpha Natural (ANR +4.6%), and Cloud Peak Energy (CLD +3.1%) are also rallying. Many coal stocks have sizable short interests, and many of those shorts have made big profits this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +1.9%) reverses earlier losses after announcing late Friday it...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +1.9%) reverses earlier losses after announcing late Friday it had entered into an At Market Issuance Sales Agreement with MLV & Co. to sell up to $75M in stock. The biotech firm also said it issued options to purchase 200K shares each to CEO Steven King and CFO Paul Lytle under the company's stock incentive plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • GLD

    Gold is higher following the CME's Friday announcement of a cut in initial gold margins to...

    Gold is higher following the CME's Friday announcement of a cut in initial gold margins to $6.6K/contract from $7.425K, effective January 2. The maintenance margin will be a lowered to $6K from $6.75K. GLD +1.4%, though the bulk of the gain has come in the last hour.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOMA

    XOMA Corp. (XOMA +1.8%) trades up after saying it's selected active non-infectious anterior...

    XOMA Corp. (XOMA +1.8%) trades up after saying it's selected active non-infectious anterior scleritis, the inflammation of the fibrous white membrane surrounding the eyeball excluding the cornea, as the third indication in it's proof-of-concept program for gevokizumab. The company will work with the National Eye Institute on designing the study protocol.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS +2.1%), Potash (POT +1.9%), and Agrium (AGU +2.2%) trade higher after Canpotex, the...

    Mosaic (MOS +2.1%), Potash (POT +1.9%), and Agrium (AGU +2.2%) trade higher after Canpotex, the fertilizer companies' offshore sales agency, announces a 1M-ton potash supply deal with China's Sinofert Holdings for 1H13. Though the deal involves a $70/ton price cut from the last contract between the parties (established in March), the Street is pleased in light of surging potash stockpiles. A deal between Canpotex and Indian buyers is expected in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • HLF

    Whitney Tilson may be cringing a bit today, as shares of Herbalife (HLF +9%) continue to claw...

    Whitney Tilson may be cringing a bit today, as shares of Herbalife (HLF +9%) continue to claw their way back from last weeks drubbing. The stock is rising again for a fourth session as some big hedge funds take advantage of the opportunity to cover shorts on the weakness created after Pershing Square's Bill Ackman accused the company of being a "sophisticated pyramid scheme." The stock has now risen nearly 30% since hitting a fresh two-year low last Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 15 Comments
  • UNXL

    Midday top 10 gainers: UNXL +22%. AMRS +21%. DUF +20%. PTEK +17%. FFNM +17%. LXRX +15%.FORD...

    Midday top 10 gainers: UNXL +22%. AMRS +21%. DUF +20%. PTEK +17%. FFNM +17%. LXRX +15%.FORD +15%. ALJ +15%. PMFG +12%. EXE +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: EMITF -13%. CFBK -12%. MARK -10%. CALM -10%. DLIA -10%. BIOF -9%.LTBR -9%. GRH -9%. WSBF -8%.FSI -8%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MTP

    Dara BioSciences (DARA -3.3%) dips after saying it's has entered into a $2.8M securities...

    Dara BioSciences (DARA -3.3%) dips after saying it's has entered into a $2.8M securities purchase agreement with some select investors for mix of convertible preferred stock and warrants. None of the warrants are exercisable for six months from the initial issuance date, and the convertible preferred stock is convertible at any time into shares of common stock at an initial conversion price of $0.76 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CRUS

    As is its custom, Cirrus Logic (CRUS +5.3%) is following Apple higher today. Shares of the audio...

    As is its custom, Cirrus Logic (CRUS +5.3%) is following Apple higher today. Shares of the audio codec chipmaker are still down 37% from their September high, and 11.5% of the float was shorted as of Dec. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • M

    Macy's (M +3.6%) trades higher after CEO Terry Lundgren offers up a positive spin on the...

    Macy's (M +3.6%) trades higher after CEO Terry Lundgren offers up a positive spin on the retailer's Q4 sales. A new localization program developed by the company and strong online sales are believed to have helped drive sales higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • CALM

    Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM -10.2%) are getting hit today after its FQ2 bottom line missed...

    Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM -10.2%) are getting hit today after its FQ2 bottom line missed estimates this morning. Net earnings fell 39% Y/Y as higher feed costs and acquisition expenses offset higher prices for fresh-shell eggs. The company also noted that feed costs are likely to remain high and volatile for the remainder of fiscal 2013, which will put further pressure on margins over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • CLF

    Shares of coal and iron-ore producer Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.5%) get an added boost...

    Shares of coal and iron-ore producer Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.5%) get an added boost this morning on strong manufacturing data out of China overnight. The numbers give triangulation to the China rebound thesis when you add in earlier reports of a big jump in iron ore prices. The iron ore market is dominated by the Asian giant, accounting for about 60% of global demand, so, as goes China - so goes CLF.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • ALJ

    Alon USA Energy (ALJ +10.2%) adds to its big Friday gains after Goldman starts coverage with a...

    Alon USA Energy (ALJ +10.2%) adds to its big Friday gains after Goldman starts coverage with a Buy and $21 PT. The firm notes ALJ, whose refining ops center around a Texas facility, benefits from spreads between Brent-WTI, WTI-Midland, and WTI-Cushing oil prices, and thinks the recent IPO of Alon USA Partners (ALDW +0.8%) which contains ALJ's interest in the refinery, will "help investors recognize the inherent value of the asset." ALDW has been launched at Neutral due to valuation concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • AAPL

    After closing on Friday near 10-month lows, Apple (AAPL +3.1%) is rallying in the absence of...

    After closing on Friday near 10-month lows, Apple (AAPL +3.1%) is rallying in the absence of major news. Likely helping: a weekend Barron's column that made a bull case for the stock while suggesting much of the "fast money" that had joined the bandwagon is now gone. Also, year-end sales made for tax purposes might now be letting up.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 24 Comments
  • MGLN

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN -4.2%) slips this morning after noting in an SEC filing that one...

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN -4.2%) slips this morning after noting in an SEC filing that one of its commercial health plan customers doesn't intend to renew its contract and is going to contract with another behavioral health management vendor. For the previous nine months ended September 30, revenue from the account totaled around $144.5M, however the company doesnt' expect the cancellation to affect its guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • AMRS

    Amyris Biotechnologies (AMRS +16%) bounces big, maybe on word 3 company insiders took down more...

    Amyris Biotechnologies (AMRS +16%) bounces big, maybe on word 3 company insiders took down more than one-third of last week's $42.25M private placement. Among them were former Qatar PM Sheikh Abdullah bin Khalifa Al Thani who more than doubled his stake, and now owns 8% of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • M

    Shares of Macy's (M +2.8%)strike higher after putting in a weak performance last week. The...

    Shares of Macy's (M +2.8%)strike higher after putting in a weak performance last week. The company has been set up as a retail casualty from the fiscal cliff due to its slightly higher reliance compared to peers to its heavy coat segment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • AAL

    Airline stocks climb higher after a merger between American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) and US Airways...

    Airline stocks climb higher after a merger between American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) and US Airways gets the tentative backing of American's pilots. Though Congress has a lot on its plate, industry watchers see the potential for looser rules on foreign ownership of domestic carriers as a potential boost for M&A activity in the sector during the coming year. Advancers: LCC +2.0%, DAL +2.0%, UAL +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Like Sherlock Holmes and Professor James Moriarty, Democrats and Republicans may...

    Market preview: Like Sherlock Holmes and Professor James Moriarty, Democrats and Republicans may be about to tumble over the fiscal cliff in a mutual rolling bear hug that could take the U.S. economy with them, but investors remain sanguine as reports filter through that a deal could still be reached. If we can get away from the cliff imagery for a minute, Shakespeare also sums the situation up quite nicely: "As two spent swimmers, that do cling together and choke their art." The S&P is +0.75%. Later: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook, USDA Ag. Prices
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 5 Comments
  • LXRX

    Premarket gainers: LXRX +7%.

    Premarket gainers: LXRX +7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM

  • U.S. stock futures are higher premarket on the last trading day of the year despite the...

    U.S. stock futures are higher premarket on the last trading day of the year despite the inability of Washington to agree to a deal on the fiscal cliff. The calm reaction of the markets could suggest investors believe that today's cliff deadline is not really so critical after all and that a deal in a week or two will be just as good. Dow +0.2%, S&P +0.4%, Nasdaq +0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 AM | 4 Comments

  • Most European shares are lower amidst depressed volumes in what's set to be a shortened trading...

    Most European shares are lower amidst depressed volumes in what's set to be a shortened trading day in many of the markets that are open - a large chunk are closed - dragged down by the lack of a deal to avert the U.S. fiscal cliff. However, the absence of panic reflects the dream that Washington will forge a deal early in the New Year. London -0.5%, Paris +0.3%, Frankfurt closed, Milan closed, Madrid -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 AM

  • Although the U.S. looks like it's about to fall off the fiscal cliff, Asian investors don't seem...

    Although the U.S. looks like it's about to fall off the fiscal cliff, Asian investors don't seem to be panicking, with shares mixed ahead of more crunch talks today. Japan closed after finishing +23% for the year on Friday. Hong Kong flat. China +1.6%, India -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 AM

  • Chinese shares look set to post their first annual gain in three years, helped on the last day...

    Chinese shares look set to post their first annual gain in three years, helped on the last day by positive PMI data and a plan to allow brokerages, P-E houses and insurers to set up mutual funds. The move adds to the increasing liberalization of China's markets, with Beijing recently raising investment quotas or ceilings for foreign institutions and central banks. The SSE Composite Index is +1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 AM
